title: Are You Having Problems With Idiot Teammates?
body:
This bitch right here! {{champion:117}} 

Is that pesky Jungler flanking to delete your ADC?  Smack him on the head with a Q and tell him to slow the fuck down! 

Your team's assassin forget to buy boots like a moron and is moving in for the kill at the speed of a tree? Speed that fucker up with a W and watch him say "too easy". 

Yi going in for the two shot? Turn that asshat into a fucking rabbit and throw that fucker into a stew! 

Want to Q shit from outer fucking space because your  teammate can't  secure kills for dick? Send out a pissed off little fairy to snipe his ass!  

Does your Teemo like to sit in enemies' laps because hes too fucking stupid to kite? Wild Growth that nigga have 'em thinkin' it's D III up in this bitch!

WAAAAAAAAAY tooooo many people think when {{champion:16}}  is championed in a game with some other person claiming they are the experts or better than anyone else with their comments ruining team morale; which begins to be ruined when way too many people think; with {{champion:16}}  we have a healer so I can carry less of these {{item:2003}}  to help any champion heal especially when they think never to boost with {{summoner:7}}  for their champion.

So, before the game starts and the champions can be sized up, this time would also be a good time to tell people maybe the first time playing a champion or still knew with a certain champion in a bots game for practice. Which could explain the amount of deaths increasing as they learn the timing and inner intimate details of the champion, because not a full time as some people might be stuck on "gosh they suck beyond excrement" level of ability; which is maybe much of what I receive when Championing {{champion:16}}  and throwing myself into the fray for my teammates to witness the combinations of my death the enemy bots are throwing at us, or to help save their lives.

I used to help protect my older brother, Warrior in the Gauntlet in the arcade. So way too many death decoy strategies and tactics have been made inside of my mind {to help him beat the game with spending less of his money, while I would spend more of my money. Which I know my mind is already amplified in some intellectual discussions while needing to learn video gaming killing in deaths to other game characters skills abilities; because I spent my time in sports growing up more than with other versions of video games after Atari.

Please, excuse me when I Champion with {{champion:16}}. I witnessed her ability if items are correct to slay the Legendary Dragon. When I Champion {{champion:16}}  I observe some of the animal characteristics and maybe that is a baseline thought as to why with {{champion:16}}  I never slay the Legendary Dragon. Though I will team tandem and heal or help others to slay the Legendary Dragon. I am not a last striker after another Champion has made all of the time and homework to slay the monsters. However, with {{champion:131}} I can Slay the Legendary Dragon solo at times, and a feat which took me some confidence to find. There is less of an encounter with confidence gaining experiences when a person never tries at all; a valuable lesson in video gaming I have finally experienced and learned because my older brother is not around to defeat the Bosses of Larger Animal Monsters.

My bottom-line when Championing with {{champion:16}} is that I am a healer through and through for lane teammates and my team. I will flank long to other lanes to share my {{summoner:7}}   and my {{summoner:13}} = mana/ boosts which, (mana) I normally carry when Championing {{champion:16}}. Which is another important item many magical characters are without in their arsenals when they would rather carry other boosts. From FuryofThornsRedo

Is your team full of pansies that are always too scared to start a fight? Does your adc refuse to auto attack in anything but an all in? Did your stupid jungler and top laner both pick squishy champions? Then {{champion:89}} is for you!

 Loaded with 3, count 'em 3 hard CC abilities, Leona is perfect when your top laner just had to be {{champion:92}}, your mid laner just had to be {{champion:238}} , and your jungler just had to be {{champion:76}}. Terrible team comps begone; you can carry all three of those idiots with everything {{champion:89}} brings to the table. You have tons of CC to lock down enemy squishies, and you're also tanky enough to survive the slow follow up from your teammates that weren't paying attention. 

But it doesn't stop there! Those 3 fuckwads leave your poor {{champion:222}}  to 1v1 the enemy {{champion:254}} ? Have no fear! {{champion:89}} is an excellent peeler as well. Between your multiple stuns, passive damage, and your adc's massive dps, you'll take care of that pesky diver in no time. Did I mention that {{champion:89}} is also a sexy, fiery redhead?




Now, will you be paying with cash or credit?

Except in Bronze/low Silver. There, most of the time when I stun their carries (mainly I target whoever is the most fed) my teammates don't target them. That's why I prefer damagey AP champions like Lulu or Sona as opposed to full utility champs like Leona that require a follow up. Hell, I can make plays better with Blitzcrank because he doesn't depend on his teammates to follow through.

> [{quoted}](name=PhasePrime,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=Kczy71Au,comment-id=00070002,timestamp=2015-02-23T23:19:54.753+0000)
>
> Except in Bronze/low Silver. There, most of the time when I stun their carries (mainly I target whoever is the most fed) my teammates don't target them. That's why I prefer damagey AP champions like Lulu or Sona as opposed to full utility champs like Leona that require a follow up. Hell, I can make plays better with Blitzcrank because he doesn't depend on his teammates to follow through.

Generally speaking, when I play {{champion:89}} , I often won't engage directly on enemy squishies if I'm the one that has to initiate the teamfight. Her CC just doesn't last long enough to really secure kills on enemy priority targets unless your team has very specific champions. What I will often do instead is initiate on the enemy front line and get my team to focus on them, and then save my ult for if the enemy carries get too brave while we're fighting their frontline. And if you have to tank the enemy carries for a while to do this? So be it; you bought all those tank items for a reason, after all.

People tend to think that it's always best to initiate on enemy squishies, but I find this is only true if you have the firepower and swiftness needed to kill or force them out of the fight before the enemy team can really respond. Obviously, if the enemy adc is massively out of position, feel free to just shit on them. But in general, I find it more effective to take the fight to the enemy front line first and then slowly work your way forward to the enemy back line. This is especially true if the enemy has a very strong peeling presence like a {{champion:40}} and a {{champion:90}} . You simply aren't going to be able to dive and kill that enemy adc, so stop trying. The enemy adc's dont have that long of range, and Janna can only really do her job if your team tunnels on diving her adc. Why play her game if you don't have to?
If I can stunlock their carry while my team with actual damage takes care of the frontline however, it's kinda great.

Did we also forget to mention she has one of the stupidest mother F%^&*@G ults in the game with a maximum strength slow or stun while being on a ridiculously short cooldown? 

(I'm not raging, just mimicking Trinimmortal.)

But seriously, Leona's ult is ridiculous for what it does. As a comparison, let's look at hers and Nami's ults.

> [{quoted}](name=SpecterVonBaren,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=Kczy71Au,comment-id=00070004,timestamp=2015-02-24T19:59:00.075+0000)
>
> Did we also forget to mention she has one of the stupidest mother F%^&*@G ults in the game with a maximum strength slow or stun while being on a ridiculously short cooldown? 
> 
> (I'm not raging, just mimicking Trinimmortal.)
> 
> But seriously, Leona's ult is ridiculous for what it does. As a comparison, let's look at hers and Nami's ults.

I would argue that Nami's ult is a much stronger counterengage because its a very wide projectile that moves in a long line, and knocks people up as well as slowing them after. It's pretty easy to juke a Leona ult if you have a mobility spell. The only person that can consistently deal with Nami's ult, when used as a counter engage, is {{champion:157}}. Leona's Ult is definitely a much stronger offensive ability though, but it has the tradeoff of being less than optimal when used defensively, since Leona's ult is usually best as a follow up to other hard CC. Nami's is the opposite, since it is slow moving and has a decent cast time, but neither of these factors matter nearly as much when used defensively rather than aggressively.

Very true. My only real issue with Leona's ult is just the short cooldown it has. If a Leona uses her ult in lane and it results in her ADC getting a kill or double kill then by the time both them and the enemy laners have come back from base, her ult is almost ready to go again. Its just frustrating how a Leona can take a small lead and just keep pushing it so easily.
i paid with credit. my queen loves her sugar daddy.

Have some Koolaid. You're a noob when you're thirsty!

                                     ~~~FB Lulu

Is your adc an idiot who never pokes back at a bursty enemy ADC such as {{champion:104}} or can't dodge a skillshot despite having superior range on their AA? 

Pick {{champion:201}} !
Not only does he slow your enemy down with massive chunk if he lands his Q, but it also adds a proc that if your ADC follows, can stun an enemy for 1.25 seconds at earlier level! 
Want some damage on that Q? Build some health! 
Not only will you be more tanky, but you'll also get stronger the more tankier you build! 

What was that? Your ADC is in trouble because {{champion:51}} ults? Jump between them with your W! Not only does it help your ADC as it helps give them massive amount of armor and MR along with you, but it also lets you block the bullet with your massive, muscular body capable of punching through the mountain! 
You have low health? Who cares! Throw in your E in front of you and you'll block all the projectiles! {{champion:222}} with her Super Mega Death Rocket? {{champion:103}} 's lovely charm? You can all catch them for your ADC, and not receive a scratch on your fantastic mustache. 
Did you know you can prevent Zed from killing you with his pesky Death Mark and he thinks you'll poot and die with the built up damage of his deathmark? THINK AGAIN! 

A team engages on your squishy teammates? Fear not! Not only does your ult knock up all enemies caught up in it, but they'll be massively slowed for the duration they are in the leftover ice gap, allowing your teammates to follow up easily. Also perfect for letting your team escape in narrow jungle! 
Did I mention his awesome mustache?

Build a Lich Bane and and Morellonomicon and watch your enemies crumble before you! Lich Bane + Passive + Q aura can, and will, wreck just about anything.

If you go full AP, your W will heal and shield more than if you just bought a few AP items like Frost Queen's Claim and Ardent Censer. Your E also scales with AP, so you can speed yourself and your teammates up to knock bitches onto their knees. 

Bitches running too fast for your E? Just flash ult and watch them dance for you as they're obliterated by your insanely strong passive because you built Lich Bane among other things!

Full AP Sona is too strong!

There is no cure for idiot teammates. Unfortunately we are stuck with the bronzetards and silverderps that inhabit this game. It's like life, you can only point and laugh at these people as the blunder by you.

Tired of idiot teammates? Pick {{champion:78}} . So you're just in their base, minding your own business while you spam your /dance emote, and then boom, Ashe arrow out of nowhere and their whole team jumps you. Press R, penta kill under the 2 turrets and you highhandedly end the game while your team is getting executed to Krugs.

...I miss when this actually worked. Turning a pick into a penta is glorious.
